page.title: 14NEWS IN NASSINGTON.
page.content: There are two stories about Nassington this week.The first,called {DANCING IN NASSINGTON}is in the {Lincoln,Rutland and Stamford Mercury}.It is about May Day celebrations held on May the 18th. There was may pole dancing by children from school, a hobby horse, crowning of the May King and Queen,a display by the Willow Brook Local History Society of an old carpenters shop,teas and lots of side shows.It was organised by Nassington Village Hall Committee.The second was called Village Motel Plan and was in the{Oundle Standard}.It was about the landlord of the Queens Head who wants to get permission to build a 14 room motel on the land between the pub and the river.He wants to build it in Bradstone with fake Collyweston Slate for the roof.There will be a car park for 44 cars.The papers cost 10-24p and are printed in Peterborough.
